nodes.bodyText: I'm really on the fence. I like that it is more direct, but the later operations are what give me trouble. Specifically I don't like how it's kind of a 'hack' where a reader has to see "okay, in this case the set is empty, so we then get no-op, no-op, no-op, okay, we returned an empty set". Having it be more direct I think is more clear. IE: "if this does not contain, then we return empty set, otherwise we take the set, transform it, and return that".

nodes.bodyText:
It is between:
    return !contains.containsKey(territoryName)
        ? Set.of()
        : contains.get(territoryName).stream()
            .map(this::getPolygons)
            .flatMap(Collection::stream)
            .collect(Collectors.toSet());

Or the getDefault with no-ops.

nodes.bodyText:
Went with the 'getOrDefault' approach: 0edd2bc
The !contains is also problematic as well (still incur cognitive complexity from the if statement, leading an if condition with a not adds yet more cognitive complexity).
